channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: With a website and social-media channel, Ukrainians are posting about Russian military deaths that Moscow hasn’t disclosed. “Those are the horrors of war launched by your president.” https://t.co/yayjH1c28s

From @WSJopinion: Ukraine’s fight for survival ought to give us some pause from the hysterical tenor of our domestic political debate, writes @gerardtbaker. It’s a reminder that freedom isn’t something we can take for granted. https://t.co/27KAkh0O7S
Russian booze is getting the boot from more American shelves, as state leaders denounce the country’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/wgbMb5KGss

The U.S. and other producers are set to release oil from their emergency stockpiles as crude prices surge, amid supply concerns after Russia invaded Ukraine, explains @ahirtens #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/LreE3yJe0P https://t.co/rLqUilbU9A

The Russian advance on Kyiv has "stalled amid food and fuel shortages, Ukrainian resistance, and slower than expected troop movement toward the capital," a senior U.S. defense official said https://t.co/ldEp6vM2DK
“I live in fear, but not for myself.” A children’s hospital in Kyiv is under strain—and doctors are bracing for an influx of casualties. https://t.co/N5cOnbnSGM
U.S. and other major oil-consuming nations will release 60 million barrels of oil from emergency stockpiles amid a price surge caused by the Ukraine crisis https://t.co/B0aIzEvtCD
What to know about Vladimir Putin's nuclear arsenal https://t.co/Gk6ZPslqrf

The number of Ukrainian refugees fleeing the country is rising rapidly and reached 660,000 early Tuesday, according to the United Nations refugee agency. If the situation escalates, 4 million people could flee, the agency said. https://t.co/YNnIjJFfRi

Heard on the Street: Russia’s economic isolation is a boon for China in some ways but sends a strong signal on the West’s willingness and ability to employ brutal financial sanctions when roused https://t.co/P39jVucDgO
The International Skating Union announced a ban on Russian figure skaters ahead of the world championships in late March https://t.co/czMbgxhhYl
As Russian attacks mount, Ukraine’s President Zelensky delivered an emotional video address to the European Parliament: “We are giving our lives for the right to be equal” https://t.co/ftOpGqI8L5

Far from the war zone, the Russian invasion of Ukraine is causing major disruptions for the global shipping industry. Hundreds of vessels are trapped and freight rates have surged. https://t.co/ZPk1roI9LM
On Yellowstone's 150th anniversary, here's a look at how America's first national park paved the way for others across the U.S., and what’s in store to preserve its future https://t.co/mP7Tvy07zj

President Biden is expected to address Ukraine, Covid-19 and his Build Back Better agenda when he speaks before Congress Tuesday evening. Here's what to know about the State of the Union. https://t.co/7IfHXrKEZa
Watch: Russian rockets hit Ukraine’s civilian areas as a miles-long convoy of Russian armored vehicles inched closer to Kyiv https://t.co/g9LQ72BtEh
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/FS29wFUpiX

Netflix said it has no plans to add any Russian channels to its service there despite a regulation that would require the streaming giant to carry several Russian state-run broadcasters https://t.co/u5YNs4h6jW
Toyota said a computer virus at Kojima, a supplier of plastic parts for car interiors, led to the shutdown Tuesday at all of the car maker’s factories in Japan https://t.co/qFggIjCn2j

Russian forces struck the central square of the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv as Moscow, frustrated in its plans for a quick victory, switched to a new strategy of pummeling civilian areas in an attempt to demoralize Ukrainian resistance https://t.co/v9ojbYzRwj
Target says it will pay employees as much as $24 an hour in some markets as part of efforts to boost pay and benefits for its staff https://t.co/p9gKUbsGCB
New Zealand, a close U.S. ally, has been limited in how far it can go punishing Russia over its invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/BPeQiyC0uD
“From Fortress Russia to Rubble Russia in a week.” How the West turned back the clock on 30 years of post-Cold War engagement with Russia. https://t.co/6ps28PO8sZ

Biden administration officials told lawmakers that Ukrainians have weeks—not months—to mount a successful pushback against Russian advances, and it may need to involve guerrilla warfare, according to a person familiar with the matter https://t.co/4l0gRs31SB
The world’s biggest commercially operated aircraft, an object of fascination among aviation enthusiasts, was heavily damaged in fighting in Ukraine https://t.co/y3mskfXj2i
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/YDQsgCP6WT
Sen. Joe Manchin joined all GOP senators Monday in voting against a measure seeking to solidify access to abortion https://t.co/Kw6gX9GAgo
Elon Musk acknowledged that SpaceX delivered to Ukraine terminals that connect to the company's Starlink satellite-based internet service https://t.co/3NtwPYKr93
From @WSJopinion: The freedom-loving spirit of the Orange Revolution lives on, writes Stephen Ford. Ukraine will never surrender. https://t.co/0miNehjRzO

Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai is a night owl who's most productive after 10 p.m., and powers through a lot of work at that hour. “I really value quiet time in the morning.” https://t.co/RwUhhIYyBB

Disney will delay the release of its films in Russian movie theaters in response to Moscow’s “unprovoked invasion of Ukraine and the tragic humanitarian crisis” accompanying it https://t.co/BrxGi4oswf

Talks between Russia and Ukraine on a potential cease-fire ended with no deal Monday as Moscow intensified its assault, killing at least 10 civilians in a shelling attack in the eastern city of Kharkiv https://t.co/V9xHiwJzDC
U.S. is sanctioning Russia’s central bank to prevent the government from using its emergency reserve currencies to protect the economy from Western pressure campaign https://t.co/SZiyIxS6wE

Loosely organized groups of hackers appeared to bring down several key Russian websites Monday, suggesting the digital front of the deadly conflict is entering an unpredictable new phase https://t.co/3cekZjA6Cg
The U.S. is expelling a dozen Russian diplomats assigned to the United Nations in New York on allegations that they're intelligence agents https://t.co/GCacOwtXtY
California, Oregon and Washington will end their statewide mask mandates for schools and other indoor settings by March 12, in a coordinated move announced Monday https://t.co/6srRwSyHWD
Elon Musk acknowledged that SpaceX delivered to Ukraine terminals that connect to the company's Starlink satellite-based internet service https://t.co/aH1PK7IO0o

Over 520,000 refugees from Ukraine have fled to neighboring countries and up to four million refugees could follow in coming weeks, the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees said Monday https://t.co/rUxer0CCpR
TikTok has joined Meta in restricting access to some Russian state-controlled media accounts in the European Union, including RT and Sputnik https://t.co/F9jDq725Cd
From @WSJopinion: Western democracies have culpably failed to boost their military capability while indulging acts of economic and cultural self-harm, writes @HonTonyAbbott https://t.co/GlrYqnQqo8
The U.S. is in the process of expelling 12 Russian diplomats assigned to the United Nations in New York, alleging they are intelligence agents https://t.co/kamq6mQItm

As sanctions become a weapon in the Russia-Ukraine war, @WSJheard explains oil and gas have proven potent in changing Putin’s behavior before #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/WZKRukgxeZ https://t.co/RbqAoCnHuY
Richard Blum, chairman emeritus of the University of California Board of Regents and husband of U.S. Sen. Dianne Feinstein, has died from cancer. He was 86 years old. https://t.co/Mn3vXiorjf

The Taliban said that Afghans will no longer be allowed to leave the country without reason, and women will be barred from traveling without a chaperone, rejecting a key U.S. demand before the lifting of sanctions and the recognition of its government https://t.co/fvuvVCSvJD

Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai is a night owl who's most productive after 10 p.m., and powers through a lot of work at that hour. “I really value quiet time in the morning.” https://t.co/OTp7A1ULO7

Netflix said it has no plans to add any Russian channels to its service there despite a regulation that would require the streaming giant to carry several Russian state-run broadcasters https://t.co/qA5oLntL4D
The world’s biggest commercially operated aircraft, an object of fascination among aviation enthusiasts, was heavily damaged in fighting in Ukraine https://t.co/UaEZddDMzc

Companies are re-evaluating their businesses in Russia, with some curtailing their operations there or deciding to leave entirely, following the attack on Ukraine and escalating sanctions by the West https://t.co/nQIqizpQwu
The artistic team behind Russia’s submission to the Venice Biennale resigned Sunday in protest of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/I0GB29U9jm

With Ukraine still fighting to halt a Russian invasion, President Volodymyr Zelensky is asking European Union leaders to allow the country to immediately join the club, signing an application letter Monday afternoon https://t.co/HOg6m7fkEh
